alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 1:29PM EDT until June 17 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Martin County in northeastern Kentucky... Johnson County in northeastern Kentucky... North central Perry County in southeastern Kentucky... Knott County in southeastern Kentucky... Floyd County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... Northwestern Pike County in southeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Magoffin County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 129 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chandlerville to Brainard to Haddix, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Dotson around 135 PM EDT. Dock around 140 PM EDT. Allen around 145 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Alvin, Job and Elmrock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Perry; Pike
